Authors: Lulu Shen, Y. C. Dai, Bao-Kai Cui
Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of the brown-rot fungi: Postia and its
related genera
Keywords:
Fomitopsidaceae, Multi-marker analysis, Phylogeny,
Taxonomy, Wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Phylogenetic and taxonomic studies on the brown-rot fungi,
Postia and its related genera, are carried out. Phylogeny based on
multiple loci DNA sequences including the internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) regions, the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU), the
small subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nSSU), the small subunit
mitochondrial rRNA gene (mtSSU), the translation elongation factor 1-Î±
gene (tef1), the largest subunit of RNA polymerase II (rpb1) and the
second subunit of RNA polymerase II (rpb2) recognized ten distantly
related clades of Postia sensu lato (s. l.). Four new genera,
Amaropostia, Calcipostia, Cystidiopostia, Fuscopostia are established,
nine new species, Amaropostia hainanensis, Cyanosporus fusiformis, C.
micropora, C. mongolicus , C. piceicola, C. subhirsuta, C. tricolor, C.
ungulata, Postia sublowei are identified. Illustrated descriptions of
the new species and genera are described. Identification keys to Postia
and its related genera, as well as keys to the species of each genus are
provided.
